page.title: 03THE FORD
page.content: THE FORD The ford is about 3 kilometres from the Cricketers Public House on{Danbury {Common.}There is marshland, a waterlogged area, surrounding the ford. The level of water in a marsh is seasonal. Flooding is caused in winter, and this affects the nature of the vegetation. In the marshland the soil is composed of inorganic material, often at the edge of a pond or lake. On the ponds in the marshy areas duckweed and reedmaces, or bulrushes, are to be found. Either side of the road at the ford the river is quite deep, but it is shallow on the road, except after heavy rainfall. There is a little wooden bridge to the left of the ford, for pedestrians. The river, thought to be Sandon Brook, runs into more marshland owned by the{National Trust.}
